channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Yellow Citroen DS3, 15th January
item.description:
Citroen DS3 is not used. Hasn't moved in over a year. The number plate KW10 UBH comes under a BLACK AUDI therefore must be a stolen vehicle. PLEASE REMOVE AS THIS IS TAKING UP CAR PARKING SPACES ON A DEAD ROAD WHICH IS ALREADY FULL. (you will 3 car parks on your left as you drive up the road and its in the 4th miniature car park where you will see a food truck).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Duddington Close, Mottingham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: O/S no 187 LARGE POTHOLE IN THE ROAD, 15th January
item.description:
Resident reporting there is a large pothole in the road as the buses drive over the dip it makes a loud noise like a bump and it can be felt in the house. Cracks are appearing on resident's walls and have got bigger. Please could someone look into this It is mainly the buses and lorries as it is a through road for traffic, especially as the buses are electric and more heavier.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hook Lane, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car no mot, 15th January
item.description:
Car been dumped in same place for over a year taking up valuable parking space. Mot run out in November 25 and it still hasn't moved. Without a valid mot the tax is now not valid so how will this car be moved? Please come and sort this out. It's located at maran way, near one the the garage entrances. No: AV59 VKK. Same person has more then one car been left in spaces for long periods of time but this is the only one that has run out of MOT atm.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maran Way, Lessness Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain collapsing on entry to big roundabout. Just past ikea, 15th January
item.description:
The drain is collapsing and if car hits it wrong it really notices. My brake fluid tube under the car was split by this. It has been like this for quite a few months. It’s as you enter the roundabout from peartree avenue. Going towards Brockelbank shopping centre.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bugsbys Way, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 12 inch pothole, getting larger, opposite bus stop., 15th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Worsley Bridge Road, New Beckenham, Greater London

item.title: More rubbish left by 234 high street occupiers, 15th January
item.description:
This is a health hazard and detrimental to Bromley’s image. It is embarrassing that people can come to visit London’s Greenest borough and find that it is regarded by its local residents as a wasteland. This properties occupants consistently maintain a low standard of hygiene and respect for the local area by leaving rubbish out in the streets. Rats have occupied the area and causing a local health risk to children and elderly. This needs to be escalated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harmony Way, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: KN18 GSU has been parked/dumped at this location for over six months, 15th January
item.description:
KN18 GSU has been parked/dumped at this location for over six months now and has not moved. There is a large amount of motor oil being deposited on to the roadway from underneath this vehicle which is flowing into the roadway drain near it. Vehicle is opposite 11 Wessex Drive.

item.title: Drain cover removed in July 2025 in the road outside 64 Archery Roadwas reported by resident, 15th January
item.description:
Council attended put bollards and barrier and said the drain cover would be replace within 8 weeks, that was six months ago. The bollards and barrier are constantly being removed onto the pavement by people who wish to park there and block walkers right of way. Large hold which a small child could fall down.needs urgent attention. This has been follwed up with phone calls to the council by residents but still not fixed. Six months and still waiting is unacceptable. Please mark URGENT.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Archery Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet
